alert.note: Alert for Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 07 at 4:11AM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING ABOVE 2000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and blowing snow possible above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches between 2000-3000 feet, except 1 to 3 feet above 3000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills and Cascade Foothills in Lane County. * WHEN...From late Monday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down trees.
info.instruction: Anyone with travel plans or recreation plans in the Cascades on Tuesday and/or Wednesday should reconsider their plans. At the very least, those who must travel will need to be well prepared with chains, a winter survival kit, and a reliable source of communication. It would also be wise to alert friends and family before traveling. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1, or visit for Oregon: https://www.tripcheck.com and for Washington: https://wsdot.com/travel/real-time/map

area.areaDesc: Cascade Foothills in Lane County; Northern Oregon Cascade Foothills
